alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 5:17PM CDT until May 16 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following county, Monroe. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 517 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monroeville, Frisco City, Peterman, Excel, Mexboro, Mexia Crossing, Mexia, West Monroeville, Ollie, Hixon, Halls Crossroads, Fountain, Monroeton, Renson, Axle, Perdue Hill, Megargel, Drewry, Manistee and Claiborne.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
